I agree with Samuel C.'s review below.  It was awesome. We ate here on 3 different occasions over 4 days....Twice for dinner and once for breakfast.  I appreciated that they had gluten free items clearly indicated; they also had gluten free bread available and it was delicious! My fiancé LOVED the beer.  The service was decent, but they were slammed both times we were there for dinner.  I would get there around 8 if you want a table and decent service...any later and you may be waiting awhile for a server to come take your order. The building is amazing.  The menu is extensive. The drinks great.
